pull.title: Remove version field from GetSerializeSize
pull.body: Drops the version field from `GetSerializeSize()`, simplifying the code in various places. Also drop `GetSerializeSizeMany()` (as just removing the version parameter could result in silent bugs) and remove unnecessary instances of `#include <version.h>`.

issue.title: Use serialization parameters for CTransaction
issue.body: Choose whether witness is included in transaction serialization via serialization parameter rather than the stream version. See #25284 and #19477 for previous context.

events.body:
Concept ACK.

Is this next after #28438? Or something else first?

Playing around locally, I was also able to drop the include in:
```bash
$ git diff --stat
 src/bitcoin-util.cpp            | 1 -
 src/coins.cpp                   | 1 -
 src/core_read.cpp               | 1 -
 src/kernel/coinstats.cpp        | 1 -
 src/rest.cpp                    | 1 -
 src/script/bitcoinconsensus.cpp | 1 -
 src/zmq/zmqpublishnotifier.cpp  | 1 -
```

(I didn't mess with the tests, maybe could drop some there too).

Also worth pointing out: libbitcoinkernel now only requires `version.h` for `signet.cpp`, which I assume will go away in one of these follow-ups.

Edit: Not that the header dependency matters at all for libbitcoinkernel. It's just indicative imo that we're moving the right direction if it ends up un-tethered.

events.message:
serialize: Drop nVersion from [C]SizeComputer

Protocol version is no longer needed to work out the serialized size
of objects so drop that information from CSizeComputer and rename the
class to SizeComputer.
serialize: Drop useless version param from GetSerializeSize()

events.body:
Rebased after #28438 was merged.

> Is this next after #28438? Or something else first?

Either this or #28451 seem good to go; I think they conflict due to the "Convert some CDataStream.." commit here though; shouldn't be a hard rebase in either case though, I think.

> Playing around locally, I was also able to drop the include in:

Taken.

> Also worth pointing out: libbitcoinkernel now only requires `version.h` for `signet.cpp`, which I assume will go away in one of these follow-ups.

That just needs `SpanReader` and `CVectorWriter` to be updated to not need a version.

issue.title: reduce cs_main scope, guard block index 'nFile' under a local mutex
issue.body:
By not having to lock `cs_main` every time we try to access block
position on disk, we can avoid slowing down concurrent tasks due
to threads waiting for the global lock to be released.

Also, solves a edge case race inside `ReadBlockFromDisk` where
we obtain the file position locking `cs_main` and then try to access
the file without it (the file could no longer exist if pruning occurred
just in-between these two actions).

Context from where this comes from #26966.
